action.action-desc: Mr. Marino (for himself and Ms. Bass) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to increase awareness about the treatment referral routing service of the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Americans Seek Treatment Act of 2018.

section.header: Treatment referral services of the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration

subsection.header: Increasing awareness about treatment referral service
subsection.text: Section 501(d) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290aa(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (24)(E), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (25), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

conduct a national public awareness campaign to increase awareness about the treatment referral routing service of the Administration, including the toll-free telephone number for accessing such service and the types of information provided through such service to address substance use disorders.

subsection.text: Part A of title V of the Public Health Service Act is amended by inserting after section 506A of such Act (42 U.S.C. 290aa–5a) the following:

section.header: Pre-arrest referral programs for individuals with substance use disorders

subsection.text: The Secretary shall incorporate into the programs and services of the Administration, including the treatment referral routing service of the Administration, information on pre-arrest referral programs.

The term pre-arrest referral program means a program operated by a local law enforcement agency which permits individuals with substance use disorders to seek assistance at the law enforcement agency and provides assurances to such individuals that they will not be subject to criminal penalties related to such individual’s possession and use of controlled substances, and which may include—

paragraph.text: the provision of information related to treatment centers for individuals with substance use disorders, including such centers which provide financial assistance to individuals who are not covered by a health insurance policy;
case management and follow-up support provided by law enforcement officers to individuals who participate in the program; and
outreach to educate individuals with substance use disorders and their families about resources and treatments options.
